intro: Conostegia pittieri var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved pittieri conostegia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
